attributes.comment:
As adoptive parents of one international child, and in the process of adopting
another, I hate to have to explain to those who are incredulouse at the great
expense and time taken to adopt, that it is the United States of America that has
caused us the most red-tape and money, not the supposed "corrupt" nations we
are dealing with.

Though I appreciate that the government is working to limit the trade of children to
legitimate orphans, their own increase in fees with no explainable increase in
services seems to others and at times to me, that maybe we are participating in
the trade of children and my insides scream out "no!" There are so many orphans
who need homes in this world, couldn't our nation work with us to get those kids
off the streets, out of brothels, or from overfull orphanages by helping those who
are wanting to give those kids families?

Please, don't raise our fees and reduce our possibilities of being able to adopt,
especially when we often have to pay those fees twice because of the length of
time our own government and the foreign governments we work with take to
process all of our paperwork.

Thank you for hearing our requests!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Adoptive Mom, Kimberly Dickson
